did.unittitle: United States Political Campaign Materials collection 1840-2009 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Collection of campaign ephemera and other materials assembled by staff at the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library. Collection of campaign materials spans much of the United States political timeline, from 1840 to 2009. National and state political campaigns run by the Whig, Know-Nothing, Democratic, Republican, Libertarian, and other parties are documented through printed material, artifacts, and ephemera, such as posters, flyers, buttons, bumper stickers, party platforms, pamphlets, texts of speeches, newspapers, and clippings. Materials from state campaigns and other elections such as mayoral races chiefly come from North Carolina, with smaller amounts from Louisiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, and other states. There are some materials documenting Durham, North Carolina political history, as well as a few items pertaining to a Humphrey-Muskie committee at Duke University. Other political organizations and caucuses are also represented, including anti-war organizations, labor unions (especially the AFL-CIO), and various other citizens' groups.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], United States Political Campaign Materials Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The items in the United States Political Campaign Materials Collection were acquired from a variety of sources by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library and assembled over a period of time, roughly from the 1950s to 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Ted Holt and Paula Jeannet Mangiafico, January 2008
Updated to include accession 2009-0079 by Alice Poffinberger, March 2014.
All campaign materials acquisitions and accessions were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.
Finding aid was updated to include an unacquisitioned but fully processed addition by Alice Poffinberger in July 2009.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection of campaign materials spans most of the United States political timeline, from 1840 to 2009. National and state political campaigns run by the Whig, Know-Nothing, Democratic, Republican, Libertarian, Greenback, Independent, Citizens, and other parties, are documented through printed material, artifacts, and ephemera, such as posters, flyers, buttons, bumper stickers, party platforms, texts of speeches, pamphlets, newspapers, and clippings. Many of the items related to national party conventions. Materials from state campaigns and other elections such as mayoral races chiefly come from North Carolina, with smaller amounts from Louisiana, Maryland, Massachusetts, and other states. There are some materials documenting 20th century Durham, North Carolina political history, as well as a few items pertaining to a Humphrey-Muskie Committee at Duke University. Other political organizations and caucuses are also represented, including anti-war organizations, labor unions (especially the AFL-CIO), and various other citizens' groups such as the NAACP. The collection is divided into four series: National Elections, America Votes (materials from a 1996 exhibit of campaign memorabilia at Duke), State Elections, and Political Campaign Memorabilia. Each series is arranged by election year, with a few exceptions, and within, alphabetically by party, state, or topic. There is also a group of oversize materials separated from the main collection, chiefly newspapers and posters.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library holds thousands of bound pamphlets and manuscript collections relating to United States elections, as well as archival collections focused on individual political figures, particularly in the state of North Carolina, and Durham, Orange, and Wake counties. In addition, the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library holds these collections containing materials closely related to or complementing the collection described in this finding aid:
